required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Health Status of Patients After Surgically Implanted Biological and Mechanical Aortic Valves: a Population-based Retrospective Analysis (2010-2018)
clinical_study.official_title: Health Status of Patients After Surgically Implanted Biological and Mechanical Aortic Valves: a Population-based Retrospective Analysis (2010-2018)

collaborator.agency: A.รถ. Krankenhaus St. Josef Braunau GmbH

brief_summary.textblock: The overall project aim is to study outcomes following aortic valve replacement with either mechanical valves or bioprostheses by retrieving data from the main social security carriers in Austria for the years 2010-2018.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this research project is to evaluate mortality (primary outcome) and incidence of heart attack, stroke, reoperation and first diagnosis of heart insufficiency (secondary outcomes) after aortic valve replacement. We aim to compare those outcomes between mechanical valves and bioprostheses.
Data will be retrieved from the main social security carriers in Austria (covering 98% of its population) from 2010-2018.

primary_outcome.description: all cause mortality after aortic valve replacement

secondary_outcome.description: incidence of reoperation after aortic valve replacement
incidence of stroke after aortic valve replacement
incidence of heart attack after aortic valve replacement
incidence of heart insufficiency after aortic valve replacement

arm_group.arm_group_label: Aortic valve replacement with mechanical valves

intervention.arm_group_label: Aortic valve replacement with mechanical valves

study_pop.textblock: All patients who underwent isolated surgical aortic valve replacement in Austria above 18 years of age with no other concomitant heart surgery were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- isolated surgical aortic valve replacement in Austria
Exclusion Criteria:
- below 18 years of age
- concomitant heart surgery
